title: Mahindra Scorpio N automatic now more affordable with Z4 trim at Rs 17.39 lakh
description: The Mahindra Scorpio N now gets a torque converter automatic gearbox right from the one-above-base Z4 trim, which is priced at Rs 17.39 lakh for the petrol-engine variant and Rs 17.86 lakh for diesel. Earlier, this Mahindra SUV’s automatic range started with the Rs 18.91 lakh Z6 (diesel) and the Rs 19.06 lakh Z8 Select (petrol) variants. That makes the new Scorpio N Z4 AT more affordable than the former and latter trims by Rs 1.05 lakh and Rs 1.67 lakh, respectively. 2.2-litre diesel, 2-litre turbo-petrol engines on offer Z4 trim gets 8-inch touchscreen with wired Android Auto, Apple CarPlay Only available in the 7-seat configuration Mahindra Scorpio N Z4 engine and gearbox options 203hp turbo petrol and 132hp diesel engine options Scorpio N's 2-litre turbo petrol engine. The Scorpio N Z4 trim gets two engine options: mStallion 2-litre turbo-petrol and mHawk 2.2-litre diesel. The petrol engine is good for 203hp and 370Nm (6MT) / 380Nm (6AT), while the diesel pot churns out 132hp and 300Nm with both gearboxes. Do note that in the Z4, the RWD layout is standard, but one can have it with a 4WD system with the optional Z4 (E) diesel trim. Mahindra Scorpio N Z4 features Fabric upholstery, dual airbags Sold only in the 7-seat configuration, the Scorpio N Z4 packs goodies like LED turn indicators, 17-inch wheels with plastic covers, a rear spoiler, an 8-inch touchscreen with wired Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, steering-mounted controls, second-row AC vents and fabric upholstery. In terms of safety tech, it comes equipped with front airbags, ABS with EBD, hill hold and descent controls, ISOFIX child seat anchorages and 3-point seatbelts for all passengers. html:
The most affordable Scorpio N automatic trim has both petrol and diesel engine options.

The Mahindra Scorpio N now gets a torque converter automatic gearbox right from the one-above-base Z4 trim, which is priced at Rs 17.39 lakh for the petrol-engine variant and Rs 17.86 lakh for diesel. Earlier, this Mahindra SUV’s automatic range started with the Rs 18.91 lakh Z6 (diesel) and the Rs 19.06 lakh Z8 Select (petrol) variants. That makes the new Scorpio N Z4 AT more affordable than the former and latter trims by Rs 1.05 lakh and Rs 1.67 lakh, respectively.

  1. 2.2-litre diesel, 2-litre turbo-petrol engines on offer
  2. Z4 trim gets 8-inch touchscreen with wired Android Auto, Apple CarPlay
  3. Only available in the 7-seat configuration

Mahindra Scorpio N Z4 engine and gearbox options

203hp turbo petrol and 132hp diesel engine options


Scorpio N's 2-litre turbo petrol engine.

The Scorpio N Z4 trim gets two engine options: mStallion 2-litre turbo-petrol and mHawk 2.2-litre diesel. The petrol engine is good for 203hp and 370Nm (6MT) / 380Nm (6AT), while the diesel pot churns out 132hp and 300Nm with both gearboxes. Do note that in the Z4, the RWD layout is standard, but one can have it with a 4WD system with the optional Z4 (E) diesel trim.

Mahindra Scorpio N Z4 features

Fabric upholstery, dual airbags

Sold only in the 7-seat configuration, the Scorpio N Z4 packs goodies like LED turn indicators, 17-inch wheels with plastic covers, a rear spoiler, an 8-inch touchscreen with wired Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, steering-mounted controls, second-row AC vents and fabric upholstery. In terms of safety tech, it comes equipped with front airbags, ABS with EBD, hill hold and descent controls, ISOFIX child seat anchorages and 3-point seatbelts for all passengers.
